title: Mark Gatiss Documentaries
description:
Mark Gatiss

A History of Horror

A three part series in which Mark Gatiss celebrates the greatest achievements of horror cinema. 

1.Frankenstein Goes to Hollywood 
2.Home Counties Horror 
3.The American Scream 

Horror Europa

Mark Gatiss embarks on a chilling voyage through European horror cinema. 

MR James Ghost Writer

Mark Gatiss steps into the mind of MR James, the enigmatic English master of the supernatural story. 

My Life in Science Fiction

Accompanying BBC Two's landmark history of Science Fiction, these exclusive iPlayer films give three contrasting, but revealing, insights into the world of Science Fiction. 

1.Stories from the Stars
2.Invasion of the Fans
3.Days of Fear and Wonder 

The Real History of Science Fiction

The Real History of Science Fiction From Star Wars to 2001: A Space Odyssey, and from Jurassic Park to Doctor Who, each program is packed with contributors behind these creations and traces the developments of Robots, Space, Invasion and Time. Narrated by Mark Gatiss, Doctor Who writer, actor, and co-creator of the BBC’s Sherlock, the series determines why science fiction is not merely a genre… for its audience it’s a portal to a multi-verse – one that is all too easy to get lost in.

1.Robots
2.Space
3.Invasion
4.Time
